snippet: National health spending grew slowly in 2012, posting a relatively small increase for a fourth consecutive year.
abstract: Federal government says national health spending grew slowly for fourth consecutive year, increasing 3.7 percent in 2012 to $2.8 trillion; officials disagree over whether Affordable Care Act or lingering effects of recession were primarily responsible for trend.
lead_paragraph: National health spending grew slowly in 2012, posting a relatively small increase for a fourth consecutive year.

headline.main: Another Modest Rise for Health Costs
headline.print_headline: Another Modest Rise for Health Costs

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
